entry.title: Russia Calls on Ukraine's Surrounded Mariupol Forces to Surrender
entry.content: Moscow offered Mariupol’s defenders an hourslong cease-fire that it said would allow them to leave the battlefield unscathed, as it closed in on capturing the strategic port city after weeks of heavy bombardment.

entry.title: Russia and Ukraine Build Forces for Looming Battles in East
entry.content: The two countries’ militaries will be operating on open terrain well-suited for massed forces unlike earlier skirmishing around Kyiv.

entry.title: Inside a Shanghai Quarantine Center: No Showers, Lights On 24/7
entry.content: Almost three weeks of forced isolation after a positive Covid-19 test made Jane Polubotko, a Ukrainian, feel like a “Covid criminal.”

entry.title: After More Than a Month of Fighting, Much of Mariupol Lies in Ruins
entry.content: The key Ukrainian port city has seen some of the fiercest urban warfare since the Russians invaded.

entry.title: Venezuelans Flee Again,This Time to the U.S.
entry.content: Struggling in countries hard-hit by the pandemic, tens of thousands of displaced Venezuelans are on the move again, trekking to the U.S. in search of asylum and stability.

entry.title: At Least 150 Injured in Clashes at Jerusalem Holy Site
entry.content: Israeli police said young masked men used fireworks, stones and other heavy objects to attack security forces around Al Aqsa mosque.

entry.title: 'I Lost James.' An American Dad Hunts for His 8-Year-Old in the Chaos of Afghanistan's Fall.
entry.content: James was separated from his family in the mob pushing to enter the Kabul airport before the Taliban takeover last summer. That left his father with a terrible choice.
